{"step_by_step_thinking": "Macrosomia refers to a newborn who's significantly larger than average. A baby diagnosed with this condition has a birth weight of more than 8 pounds, 13 ounces (4,000 grams), regardless of his or her gestational age. This condition is usually diagnosed at birth or after birth. It is not possible to diagnose macrosomia during the early weeks of pregnancy (11-14 weeks) because the baby is still developing and growing.", "answer_choice": "B. no"}
